Executive Assistant to the COO Job at Talent Sync Services




        
    

        
        At Talent Sync Services, we specialize in delivering tailored HR solutions to help businesses thrive. From recruitment and onboarding to performance management and compliance, we align talent strategies with organizational goals. Our commitment to excellence, personalized service, and innovative approaches ensures your workforce remains your greatest asset. Let us partner with you to unlock the full potential of your team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the COO

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are recruiting a proactive and organised Executive Assistant to support the COO.
	The ideal candidate will manage schedules, oversee communication, and ensure smooth operational coordination across the business.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the COO’s calendar, meetings, and travel logistics.
	Prepare reports, briefs, and documentation for leadership meetings.
	Track tasks, action items, and cross-departmental deliverables.
	Act as the first point of contact for internal and external engagements.
	Provide operational support to the COO in daily business oversight.
	Maintain confidentiality and professionalism in communication.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Administration, Social Sciences, or related fields.
	2–4 years of experience in an EA or administrative role.
	Excellent organisational and time-management skills.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office tools.
	Composed, reliable, and discreet.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentsync1@outlook.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Graduate Trainee, Marketing Job at GrowthBoosters




        
    

        
        At GrowthBoosters, we are leading this movement, changing how Nigerian SMEs access capital and how individual investors grow their income. As a SEC-licensed, pioneering crowdfunding platform in Nigeria, we connect businesses in need of financing with everyday investors seeking attractive returns and investment opportunities Nigeria.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our platform allows SMEs to raise funds on their terms, tailored to their operational cycles, while offering investors the chance to contribute to Nigeria’s growing economy. We utilize AI technology and human expertise to vet all investment opportunities, focusing on high-growth, responsible local businesses. This means you can invest in vetted Nigerian businesses with confidence. At our core, we are driven by financial inclusion, aligned with the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) 1, 7, 8, and 9. We are a secure investment platform with Nigerian SME expertise and transparent crowdfunding.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graduate Trainee, Marketing
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	GrowthBoosters is seeking an energetic, target-driven Graduate Trainee to support our B2C engagement and retail-investor acquisition efforts in Ibadan.
	The ideal candidate is passionate about financial services, thrives in people-facing environments, and is comfortable executing both online and offline engagement activities.


Key Responsibilities
Brand Awareness & Campaigns:


	Boost brand visibility across Ibadan through user-centric marketing campaigns.
	Support the creation and deployment of grassroots awareness strategies tailored to local communities.
	Conduct market research to understand user behaviours, needs, and engagement patterns.


Investor Acquisition (B2C):


	Execute B2C acquisition strategy aimed at identifying, engaging, and converting new retail investors.
	Conduct one-on-one engagements with prospective users to explain platform benefits.
	Drive street marketing activation—markets, malls, events, campuses, trade clusters, etc.
	Build a pipeline of prospective users and follow up to achieve weekly/monthly conversion targets.


Engagement & Support:


	Assist in onboarding new users onto the platform, ensuring a smooth first-time experience.
	Collect and analyse customer feedback to inform product and marketing decisions.
	Participate in community events, awareness drives, outreach sessions, and investor education activities.


Requirements


	Diploma or degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field.
	1 year of experience (NYSC or internship acceptable).
	Strong research ability – able to gather insights from the field and translate them into action.
	Extroverted, confident communicator with excellent sales and persuasion skills.
	Familiarity with fintech, investment platforms, or consumer-facing digital products.
	Target-driven with strong follow-through and personal accountability.
	Comfortable with field work and street-level marketing within Ibadan.
	Basic digital marketing skills (social media, WhatsApp engagement, simple reporting).


What We Offer


	A strong learning environment in a fast-growing fintech startup.
	Direct exposure to consumer acquisition and fintech operations.
	Professional growth and performance incentives.
	Supportive, collaborative team culture.

  "description": "Suacasa is a property developer focused on building design-led properties. We build innovative and design-led schemes in a number of locations across Nigeria. We create contemporary, luxurious homes of exceptional design and specification. Our properties combine are a rich blend of creativity, intelligent design philosophy, exceptional attention to detail and eco-friendliness. As we work alongside leading consultants, interior designers and product suppliers, we enable the progression and development of meticulously thought-out schemes from the very start.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Construction Project Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Department: Projects
Business Unit: Suacasa Nigeria Limited
Reports to: COO and CEO
Directly Supervise: Project Assistant
Position Type: Full Time&nbsp;(On-site)

Purpose of Position


	To oversee and manage all aspects of our construction projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Architecture and Interior Architecture, as well as expertise in structural knowledge and construction supervision.
	This role requires effective leadership, strategic planning, and excellent project management skills to ensure the successful completion of construction projects within established timelines, budgets, and quality standards.


Responsibilities
Include but not limited to the following:


	Leading and managing construction projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to project specifications, timelines, and budget constraints.
	Collaborating with architects, interior designers, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors to ensure project requirements are clearly communicated and executed.
	Overseeing the development and implementation of project plans, including resource allocation, procurement, and risk management.
	Conducting regular site inspections to ensure compliance with construction standards, safety regulations, and design specifications.
	Monitoring construction progress, resolving any project-related issues or conflicts that may arise, and making adjustments as necessary to maintain project schedules.
	Supervising and providing guidance to project teams, including contractors, subcontractors, and other construction professionals.
	Managing project budgets, tracking expenditures, and ensuring cost-effective practices throughout the construction process.
	Facilitating effective communication and collaboration among all stakeholders involved in the project.
	Maintaining accurate project documentation, including progress reports, change orders, and other project-related records.?


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	On-time completion of construction projects.
	Adherence to project budgets and cost control.
	Quality of project deliverables, including adherence to design specifications and
	construction standards.
	Effective coordination and collaboration with project stakeholders.
	Efficient resource allocation.?


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Masters degree is an advantage.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in construction project management, preferably in architecture and interior architecture projects.
	Proven experience in leading and supervising construction projects, ensuring quality, time, and budget objectives are met.


Competencies for the Role:


	To be successful in the role the candidate would be required to demonstrate the following:
	In-depth knowledge and experience in Architecture and Interior Architecture.
	Strong understanding of construction project management principles, processes,
	and best practices.
	Proficient in structural knowledge and experienced in reviewing construction drawings and specifications.
	Demonstrated ability to lead and supervise construction projects effectively.
	Excellent organisational and time management skills, with a proven ability to meet
	deadlines and deliver results.
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with attention to detail.
	Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain positive relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders.
	Proficient in using project management software and tools.?


Salary Grade
Managerial.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates are encouraged to send their CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;sochima@suacasang.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Marketing Officer",
  "description": "At GrowthBoosters, we are leading this movement, changing how Nigerian SMEs access capital and how individual investors grow their income. As a SEC-licensed, pioneering crowdfunding platform in Nigeria, we connect businesses in need of financing with everyday investors seeking attractive returns and investment opportunities Nigeria.

Our platform allows SMEs to raise funds on their terms, tailored to their operational cycles, while offering investors the chance to contribute to Nigeria&rsquo;s growing economy. We utilize AI technology and human expertise to vet all investment opportunities, focusing on high-growth, responsible local businesses. This means you can invest in vetted Nigerian businesses with confidence. At our core, we are driven by financial inclusion, aligned with the UN&rsquo;s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) 1, 7, 8, and 9. We are a secure investment platform with Nigerian SME expertise and transparent crowdfunding.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Marketing Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	GrowthBoosters is seeking a proactive, results-oriented B2B Engagement Officer to lead the acquisition and management of SME and corporate clients across Lagos.
	This role is ideal for a self-starter who excels in field engagement, relationship-building, and closing high-quality business leads.
	The successful candidate will play a key role in expanding our B2B footprint, driving strategic partnerships, and strengthening GrowthBoosters&#39; brand visibility within the SME, retail, and asset-financing ecosystem.


Key Responsibilities
B2B Acquisition &amp; Relationship Management:


	Execute GrowthBoosters&#39; B2B acquisition strategy to identify, engage, and onboard SMEs, agencies, cooperatives, and business partners.
	Conduct structured outreach, sales visits, and presentations to explain platform benefits and funding opportunities.
	Build and manage a pipeline of qualified leads, ensuring consistent follow-up and high conversion rates.
	Develop long-term relationships with clients to encourage repeat campaigns and deeper partnerships.


Market Development &amp; Field Engagement:


	Lead field activation efforts across key business hubs, markets, associations, and trade clusters in Lagos.
	Identify partnership opportunities with aggregators, business networks, and sector associations.
	Conduct market research to understand SME pain points, financing needs, and decision-making patterns.


Client Support &amp; Coordination:


	Support SMEs through the onboarding process, ensuring smooth documentation and campaign set-up.
	Gather and share client feedback to inform product improvements and sales strategy.
	Collaborate with the Business Development Lead to refine pitch materials, messaging, and engagement tactics.


Reporting &amp; Performance:


	Track outreach activities and maintain detailed engagement records.
	Prepare weekly and monthly reports on pipeline status, conversions, and market insights.
	Consistently meet or exceed assigned B2B acquisition and engagement targets.


Requirements


	Diploma or degree or equivalent qualification in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related fields.
	Minimum 3 years of experience in B2B sales, business development, field marketing, or partnership acquisition.
	Strong understanding of fintech, lending, digital platforms, or SME-facing products.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proven ability to generate leads, manage pipelines, and close business deals.
	Target-driven, self-motivated, and highly accountable.
	Comfortable with field work across Lagos (meetings, market visits, cluster engagement).
	Ability to work independently and adapt in a fast-paced startup environment.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity to shape the B2B strategy of a growing fintech startup.
	Exposure to high-impact SME financing and alternative investment operations.
	A collaborative, mission-driven team environment.
	Clear pathways for career growth and increased responsibility.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Marketing Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	GrowthBoosters is seeking a proactive, results-oriented B2B Engagement Officer to lead the acquisition and management of SME and corporate clients across Lagos.
	This role is ideal for a self-starter who excels in field engagement, relationship-building, and closing high-quality business leads.
	The successful candidate will play a key role in expanding our B2B footprint, driving strategic partnerships, and strengthening GrowthBoosters' brand visibility within the SME, retail, and asset-financing ecosystem.


Key Responsibilities
B2B Acquisition & Relationship Management:


	Execute GrowthBoosters' B2B acquisition strategy to identify, engage, and onboard SMEs, agencies, cooperatives, and business partners.
	Conduct structured outreach, sales visits, and presentations to explain platform benefits and funding opportunities.
	Build and manage a pipeline of qualified leads, ensuring consistent follow-up and high conversion rates.
	Develop long-term relationships with clients to encourage repeat campaigns and deeper partnerships.


Market Development & Field Engagement:


	Lead field activation efforts across key business hubs, markets, associations, and trade clusters in Lagos.
	Identify partnership opportunities with aggregators, business networks, and sector associations.
	Conduct market research to understand SME pain points, financing needs, and decision-making patterns.


Client Support & Coordination:


	Support SMEs through the onboarding process, ensuring smooth documentation and campaign set-up.
	Gather and share client feedback to inform product improvements and sales strategy.
	Collaborate with the Business Development Lead to refine pitch materials, messaging, and engagement tactics.


Reporting & Performance:


	Track outreach activities and maintain detailed engagement records.
	Prepare weekly and monthly reports on pipeline status, conversions, and market insights.
	Consistently meet or exceed assigned B2B acquisition and engagement targets.


Requirements


	Diploma or degree or equivalent qualification in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related fields.
	Minimum 3 years of experience in B2B sales, business development, field marketing, or partnership acquisition.
	Strong understanding of fintech, lending, digital platforms, or SME-facing products.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proven ability to generate leads, manage pipelines, and close business deals.
	Target-driven, self-motivated, and highly accountable.
	Comfortable with field work across Lagos (meetings, market visits, cluster engagement).
	Ability to work independently and adapt in a fast-paced startup environment.
